title: Technical Analysis Mastery
description: Master chart patterns, technical indicators, and price action analysis to identify trading opportunities.
objectives: Learn key technical indicators (RSI, MACD, Moving Averages)
Master trend analysis and chart patterns
Develop entry and exit strategies using technical analysis

lessons.title: Candlestick Charts Basics

content.original: Candlestick charts display Open, High, Low, Close (OHLC) data visually. Green/white candle indicates bullish (close > open). Red/black candle indicates bearish (close < open). Body shows open-close range, wicks show high-low extremes. Patterns like Doji, Hammer, Engulfing provide trading signals.
content.simplified: Candlestick is like a visual story of price movement in one time period. Green candle means price went up (buyers won). Red candle means price went down (sellers won). The thick part (body) shows where it opened and closed. Thin lines (wicks) show highest and lowest points.

lessons.aiSummary: Candlestick = Visual OHLC data. Green/white (bullish), Red/black (bearish). Body = open-close range, Wicks = high-low extremes. Patterns predict future moves.
keyTakeaways: Each candlestick represents one time period (1min, 1hr, 1day, etc.)
Long body = strong buying/selling pressure
Long wicks = indecision or rejection of price levels
Patterns are more reliable on higher timeframes
commonMistakes: Using candlesticks in isolation without context
Relying on single candle patterns (look for confirmation)

lessons.title: Support and Resistance

content.original: Support is price level where demand is strong enough to prevent further decline. Resistance is level where selling pressure prevents further rise. These levels form at previous swing highs/lows, psychological numbers (â‚¹100, â‚¹500), moving averages. When broken, roles reverse - support becomes resistance and vice versa.
content.simplified: Support is like a floor where price bounces back up because many people want to buy at that level. Resistance is like a ceiling where price bounces back down because many people want to sell. When price breaks through support, it often becomes new resistance. Think of it like flipping a floor into a ceiling.
content.hindi: à¤¸à¤ªà¥‹à¤°à¥à¤Ÿ à¤à¤• à¤«à¥à¤²à¥‹à¤° à¤œà¥ˆà¤¸à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ à¤œà¤¹à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‡à¤¸ à¤µà¤¾à¤ªà¤¸ à¤Šà¤ªà¤° à¤‰à¤›à¤²à¤¤à¥€ à¤¹à¥ˆ à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤‚à¤•à¤¿ à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤ à¤²à¥‹à¤— à¤‰à¤¸ à¤²à¥‡à¤µà¤² à¤ªà¤° à¤–à¤°à¥€à¤¦à¤¨à¤¾ à¤šà¤¾à¤¹à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚à¥¤ à¤°à¥‡à¤œà¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤Ÿà¥‡à¤‚à¤¸ à¤à¤• à¤›à¤¤ à¤œà¥ˆà¤¸à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ à¤œà¤¹à¤¾à¤‚ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‡à¤¸ à¤µà¤¾à¤ªà¤¸ à¤¨à¥€à¤šà¥‡ à¤‰à¤›à¤²à¤¤à¥€ à¤¹à¥ˆ à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‹à¤‚à¤•à¤¿ à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤ à¤²à¥‹à¤— à¤¬à¥‡à¤šà¤¨à¤¾ à¤šà¤¾à¤¹à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚à¥¤ à¤œà¤¬ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‡à¤¸ à¤¸à¤ªà¥‹à¤°à¥à¤Ÿ à¤¤à¥‹à¤¡à¤¼ à¤¦à¥‡à¤¤à¥€ à¤¹à¥ˆ, à¤¤à¥‹ à¤µà¥‹ à¤…à¤•à¥à¤¸à¤° à¤¨à¤¯à¤¾ à¤°à¥‡à¤œà¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤Ÿà¥‡à¤‚à¤¸ à¤¬à¤¨ à¤œà¤¾à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤

lessons.aiSummary: Support = Floor (price bounces up), Resistance = Ceiling (price bounces down). Found at previous highs/lows, round numbers, MAs. Role reversal: broken support â†’ resistance.
keyTakeaways: More touches = stronger support/resistance
Buy near support, sell near resistance (in range-bound markets)
Breakout above resistance = bullish signal with volume
Use horizontal lines to mark key levels
commonMistakes: Drawing too many support/resistance lines (chart becomes messy)
Expecting exact price bounce (use zones, not precise lines)
Not waiting for confirmation after breakout (false breakouts common)

lessons.title: Moving Averages and Trends

content.original: Moving averages smooth price data to identify trends. Simple Moving Average (SMA) = arithmetic mean of prices. Exponential Moving Average (EMA) gives more weight to recent prices. Common periods: 20, 50, 200-day. Golden Cross (50 crosses above 200) = bullish. Death Cross (50 crosses below 200) = bearish. Price above MA = uptrend, below = downtrend.
content.simplified: Moving average is like averaging out price ups and downs to see the overall direction. SMA treats all days equally. EMA focuses more on recent days. When short-term average crosses above long-term average, it's a buy signal. When it crosses below, it's a sell signal. If price is above the average line, trend is up.
content.hindi: à¤®à¥‚à¤µà¤¿à¤‚à¤— à¤à¤µà¤°à¥‡à¤œ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‡à¤¸ à¤•à¥‡ à¤‰à¤¤à¤¾à¤°-à¤šà¤¢à¤¼à¤¾à¤µ à¤•à¥‹ à¤à¤µà¤°à¥‡à¤œ à¤•à¤°à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤®à¤—à¥à¤° à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤¾ à¤¦à¤¿à¤–à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤ SMA à¤¸à¤­à¥€ à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¥‹à¤‚ à¤•à¥‹ à¤¬à¤°à¤¾à¤¬à¤° à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤ EMA à¤¹à¤¾à¤² à¤•à¥‡ à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨à¥‹à¤‚ à¤ªà¤° à¤œà¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¾ à¤«à¥‹à¤•à¤¸ à¤•à¤°à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤ à¤œà¤¬ à¤¶à¥‰à¤°à¥à¤Ÿ-à¤Ÿà¤°à¥à¤® à¤à¤µà¤°à¥‡à¤œ à¤²à¥‰à¤¨à¥à¤—-à¤Ÿà¤°à¥à¤® à¤à¤µà¤°à¥‡à¤œ à¤•à¥‡ à¤Šà¤ªà¤° à¤•à¥à¤°à¥‰à¤¸ à¤•à¤°à¥‡, à¤¤à¥‹ à¤–à¤°à¥€à¤¦à¤¨à¥‡ à¤•à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¿à¤—à¥à¤¨à¤²à¥¤ à¤¨à¥€à¤šà¥‡ à¤•à¥à¤°à¥‰à¤¸ à¤•à¤°à¥‡ à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¬à¥‡à¤šà¤¨à¥‡ à¤•à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¿à¤—à¥à¤¨à¤²à¥¤ à¤…à¤—à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‡à¤¸ à¤à¤µà¤°à¥‡à¤œ à¤²à¤¾à¤‡à¤¨ à¤•à¥‡ à¤Šà¤ªà¤° à¤¹à¥ˆ, à¤¤à¥‹ à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤Šà¤ªà¤° à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤

lessons.aiSummary: Moving Averages = Trend indicators. SMA (equal weight), EMA (recent weight). Golden Cross (50>200) = bullish, Death Cross (50<200) = bearish. Price>MA = uptrend.
keyTakeaways: 20 EMA = short-term trend, 50 SMA = medium, 200 SMA = long-term
Moving averages act as dynamic support/resistance
Use multiple MAs to confirm trend strength
EMA responds faster than SMA to price changes
commonMistakes: Using MAs in choppy/sideways markets (many false signals)
Not combining with other indicators for confirmation

lessons.title: RSI and MACD Indicators

content.original: Relative Strength Index (RSI) measures momentum on 0-100 scale. Above 70 = overbought (potential reversal down), below 30 = oversold (potential reversal up). MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) shows relationship between two EMAs. MACD line crossing above signal line = bullish, below = bearish. Histogram shows momentum strength. Divergence between price and RSI/MACD signals potential reversals.
content.simplified: RSI tells if stock is overbought (too expensive, might fall) or oversold (too cheap, might rise). Above 70 = overbought, below 30 = oversold. MACD uses two moving averages - when fast line crosses above slow line, it's time to buy. When it crosses below, time to sell. Both help you time your entry and exit.
content.hindi: RSI à¤¬à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ à¤•à¤¿ à¤¸à¥à¤Ÿà¥‰à¤• à¤“à¤µà¤°à¤¬à¥‰à¤Ÿ à¤¹à¥ˆ (à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤ à¤®à¤¹à¤‚à¤—à¤¾, à¤—à¤¿à¤° à¤¸à¤•à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ) à¤¯à¤¾ à¤“à¤µà¤°à¤¸à¥‹à¤²à¥à¤¡ (à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤ à¤¸à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾, à¤¬à¤¢à¤¼ à¤¸à¤•à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ)à¥¤ 70 à¤¸à¥‡ à¤Šà¤ªà¤° = à¤“à¤µà¤°à¤¬à¥‰à¤Ÿ, 30 à¤¸à¥‡ à¤¨à¥€à¤šà¥‡ = à¤“à¤µà¤°à¤¸à¥‹à¤²à¥à¤¡à¥¤ MACD à¤¦à¥‹ à¤®à¥‚à¤µà¤¿à¤‚à¤— à¤à¤µà¤°à¥‡à¤œ à¤•à¤¾ à¤‡à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥‡à¤®à¤¾à¤² à¤•à¤°à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆ - à¤œà¤¬ à¤«à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤Ÿ à¤²à¤¾à¤‡à¤¨ à¤¸à¥à¤²à¥‹ à¤²à¤¾à¤‡à¤¨ à¤•à¥‡ à¤Šà¤ªà¤° à¤•à¥à¤°à¥‰à¤¸ à¤•à¤°à¥‡, à¤¤à¥‹ à¤–à¤°à¥€à¤¦à¤¨à¥‡ à¤•à¤¾ à¤¸à¤®à¤¯à¥¤ à¤¨à¥€à¤šà¥‡ à¤•à¥à¤°à¥‰à¤¸ à¤•à¤°à¥‡ à¤¤à¥‹ à¤¬à¥‡à¤šà¤¨à¥‡ à¤•à¤¾ à¤¸à¤®à¤¯à¥¤

lessons.aiSummary: RSI: Momentum oscillator. >70 overbought, <30 oversold. MACD: Two EMA relationship. Line crosses = buy/sell signals. Divergence = early reversal warning.
keyTakeaways: RSI 14-period is standard setting
MACD (12,26,9) are default parameters
Divergence: Price makes new high but RSI doesn't = bearish
Use RSI/MACD together with trend analysis
commonMistakes: Buying immediately when RSI hits 30 (can stay oversold in downtrend)
Selling immediately when RSI hits 70 (can stay overbought in uptrend)

lessons.title: Chart Patterns and Trading Strategies

content.original: Common reversal patterns: Head and Shoulders (bearish), Inverse H&S (bullish), Double Top/Bottom. Continuation patterns: Flags, Pennants, Triangles indicate trend will resume. Breakout from pattern with volume confirms validity. Measure target by projecting pattern height from breakout point. Combine patterns with indicators and volume for high-probability trades.
content.simplified: Some patterns tell you trend will reverse (change direction): Head and Shoulders means uptrend will become downtrend. Double Bottom means downtrend will become uptrend. Some patterns tell you trend will continue: Flags and Triangles mean same direction will resume after small pause. Always wait for price to break out of pattern with high volume before trading.
content.hindi: à¤•à¥à¤› à¤ªà¥ˆà¤Ÿà¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚ à¤•à¤¿ à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤°à¤¿à¤µà¤°à¥à¤¸ à¤¹à¥‹à¤—à¤¾ (à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤¾ à¤¬à¤¦à¤²à¥‡à¤—à¥€): à¤¹à¥‡à¤¡ à¤à¤‚à¤¡ à¤¶à¥‹à¤²à¥à¤¡à¤°à¥à¤¸ à¤®à¤¤à¤²à¤¬ à¤…à¤ªà¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤¡à¤¾à¤‰à¤¨à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤¬à¤¨ à¤œà¤¾à¤à¤—à¤¾à¥¤ à¤¡à¤¬à¤² à¤¬à¥‰à¤Ÿà¤® à¤®à¤¤à¤²à¤¬ à¤¡à¤¾à¤‰à¤¨à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤…à¤ªà¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤¬à¤¨ à¤œà¤¾à¤à¤—à¤¾à¥¤ à¤•à¥à¤› à¤ªà¥ˆà¤Ÿà¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚ à¤•à¤¿ à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¤¡ à¤œà¤¾à¤°à¥€ à¤°à¤¹à¥‡à¤—à¤¾: à¤«à¥à¤²à¥ˆà¤—à¥à¤¸ à¤”à¤° à¤Ÿà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤¯à¤‚à¤—à¤²à¥à¤¸ à¤®à¤¤à¤²à¤¬ à¤¥à¥‹à¤¡à¤¼à¥‡ à¤ªà¥‰à¤œ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦ à¤µà¤¹à¥€ à¤¦à¤¿à¤¶à¤¾à¥¤ à¤¹à¤®à¥‡à¤¶à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¾à¤‡à¤¸ à¤•à¥‡ à¤ªà¥ˆà¤Ÿà¤°à¥à¤¨ à¤¸à¥‡ à¤¹à¤¾à¤ˆ à¤µà¥‰à¤²à¥à¤¯à¥‚à¤® à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¥‡à¤•à¤†à¤‰à¤Ÿ à¤•à¤¾ à¤‡à¤‚à¤¤à¤œà¤¾à¤° à¤•à¤°à¥‡à¤‚à¥¤

lessons.aiSummary: Reversal patterns: H&S, Double Top/Bottom (trend change). Continuation: Flags, Triangles (trend resume). Volume confirms breakout. Target = pattern height from breakout.
keyTakeaways: Patterns are statistical probabilities, not guarantees
Volume must increase on breakout for validation
Larger timeframe patterns more reliable than smaller
Set stop-loss below pattern low for long trades
commonMistakes: Not having exit plan before entering trade

documentation.title: Technical Analysis Complete Guide
documentation.summary: Comprehensive notes on candlestick patterns, support/resistance, moving averages, RSI, MACD, and chart patterns. Includes practical trading strategies and risk management with technical tools.
sections: Support and Resistance: Identification and Trading
Moving Averages: SMA, EMA, and Crossover Strategies
MACD: Signal Lines, Histogram, and Interpretation
Developing Complete Trading Strategy with Technical Tools
